projects.description: Practicing basic JavaScript syntax and data structures by building a Random Quote Generator, a program that displays a randomly selected quote each time the user clicks a button.

In this project, JavaScript and object-oriented programming are used to select a random hidden phrase, which a player tries to guess by clicking letters on an onscreen or on a physical computer keyboard.
An app for a fictional company called Awesome Startup, a distributed company with remote employees working all over the world. The app allows employees to share contact information with each other.

In this project, JavaScript improves the usability of a webpage displaying only ten students at a time and adding a list of navigation links at the bottom of the page. This solution works with a list of any number of students. Also, a search component is added. The principle of 'progressive enhancement' is used: the page still displays the list of students with the JavaScript turned-off, but gets 'improved' with the JavaScript programming added.

In this project, JavaScript is used to enhance an interactive registration form for a fictional conference by: -adding customized and conditional behavior and interactivity; -validating user input and providing helpful error messages when the user enters invalid information into the form fields.

A small image gallery app is built in a modular fashion. React Router sets up routes for three default topic pages and a search page. Axios fetches data from the Flickr API and use it to display images in the app.

A web application that helps a library to manage their collection of books. Users can interact with the database by retrieving a list of books, as well as adding, updating and deleting books in the database.

The API provides a way for users to administer a school database containing information about courses: users can interact with the database by retrieving a list of courses, as well as adding, updating and deleting courses in the database. The project requires users to create an account and log-in to be able to make changes to the database.

projects.project_name: Full Stack App with React and REST API
projects.description: This application provides a way for users to administer a school database containing information about courses: users can interact with the database by retrieving a list of courses, viewing detail for a specific course, as well as creating, updating and deleting courses in the database. The project requires users to create an account and sign in to make changes to the database.
